[h1][b] Here it is, Overwatch 2 on Steam.
If you have even a bit of respect for your money and yourself do NOT spend your time (and money) on this game. [/b][/h1]

Overwatch 2 doesn't feel like the original used to be. It used to be a [b]team[/b] based hero shooter with a rock, paper, scissors design, what I mean by that is that Hero A can be countered by Hero B, Hero B by Hero C and so on. Doesn't feel like that anymore, game feels like a giant slugfest after the OW2 [i]"upgrade"[/i]. When Overwatch 2 came about they remove 2 capture point mode (Known as assault. Temple of Anubis, Hanamura, Volskaya Industries) that I LOVED, because it was a mode that really needed team coordination on both sides (Attack, Defense) to work, and introduced a Push mode that I don't think it is as fun the removed ones. The design of the push maps feel very strange to me also, there's like a bazzilion flanks which i'm not a fan, doesn't feel great to play.

[b]Let's talk about Heroes for a bit[/b]

OW1 was fun because every hero felt very different from one another, I don't really feel like this with OW2. They also changed from 6v6 with two tanks to 5v5 with one (they buffed all tanks and changed some).
I don't really know where the balance is at right now but I have some comparisons regarding the time when OW2 launched. 

Junker Queen x Roadhog - Why the fuck would you play Roadhog if the Junker Fucker can do everything he does but way better? Roadhog was an Off-tank during OW1, he supported the main tank mitigating damage by assassinating high priority targets with the hook. He can't do that anymore because he is just a giant piece of meat that gives ult charge to the enemy team since he has no real tank capabilities, he worked best with another tank.

Old Orisa vs New Orisa - She was a protector, her lore was all about that, now she's pinning people with spears around the map. She lost her identity from protector to aggressor. The logic behind that is, Old Orisa was a main tank that heavily relied on her team to do anything at all, because she was a [b]Main Tank[/b], built to soak damage and CC the other heroes. New Orisa feels like an aggressor, like if Reinhardt was always on nanoboost ignoring everything, including the safety of your team, to always keep on top of the enemy team doing damage.

Two examples, two and my blood is already boiling.

[b]MONEY AND DISRESPECT[/b]

Overwatch 2 is plaged with microtransactions and battle passes to unlock the cosmetics, during OW1 all you needed to do to unlock cosmetics as play the game and earn loot boxes, which is not great but you could get everything the game offered by simply playing it, now you want a new or old skin(OW1) you gotta pay with real money.

Blizzard today is plain evil regarding these matters, the prices are ridiculous and even old skins cost a ton, skins that you could get playing the game in the past. It's ridiculous.

Do I need to say anything about battle passes? No, I didn't think so.

Going free-to-play was their big brain move to get more money from idiots. They also clearly spend more time thinking about new skins and battle passes than the game itself.

[b]A sad conclusion[/b]

I loved the original Overwatch, I truly did. I will never forget the feelings of a match where your team was, well, working as a team, felt amazing to jump into the fray as a tank or DPS and not worry about your HP because you knew your healer as doing their part, or as a healer not worrying about your flank because the off-tank or DPS were keeping you safe.

All I feel about Overwatch 2 is boiling rage, they destroyed everything that made the original unique.

Money and e-sports, things that simply destroy fun gaming.

They took away a game I loved shitted on it then munched on and gave it back saying it was an upgrade.

[h1] I Like Overwatch 2. [/h1]  But, I don't think you will. The game itself is fun, and continues to be a great source of entertainment for me and my friends. Unfortunately, the corpos of Blizzard have completely abandoned us as players, in favor of a larger cash grab. No, I don't want to spend $15 for 48 minutes of content. No, I don't want to spend $20 for a new Reinhardt skin (I would, however, love to be rewarded for the hours that I put into this game, like how I was in OW1.) But, someone will, and they know that. I don't think a majority of this is the devs' faults, just Mr. Bobby and the board wanting more money, so they rush shit out that they know isn't what they promised and let the devs take the fall. In short, feel free to play the game, but don't feel obligated to give them money. Just give it some time (or a lot of time).

As far as I know, I bought Overwatch, not this sh1tty excuse of a sequel. Blizzard only did this to have an excuse to charge players for new characters, skins and battle passes, while in that process they also managed to screw up the whole flow of the original game, just to appear new.

So not only we, the original Overwatch buyers and players, can't play the game we paid for, but let's also not forget about the promised singleplayer campaign, the sole reason for OW2's existence, that got totally scrapped. 

Truly disgusting of Blizzard overall, they deserve all the hate.
